          skills. Seeking evolutionary role in analytics that will allow to adapt and change to company

          inquiries.  Wrote sales contracts for orders obtained and submitted orders for processing.  Achieved 170% of first 90 day quota, earning 2nd highest rookie quarter in 21 year

Built client relationships by acting as the liaison between the drafting and sales teams.  Consulted with clients after sales and contract signings to resolve problems and provide

story:
Let me transform this resume into a story:

Meet a dedicated professional who's currently pursuing their Master's in Data Analytics at the University of Houston, building upon their foundation in Finance from the same institution. Their journey is a fascinating blend of sales expertise and analytical prowess.

Their story begins in 2007 when they cut their teeth as a Recruiter, spending seven valuable years developing creative strategies for broker-dealer staffing needs. They masterfully managed advisor transitions and served as a crucial bridge between broker-dealers and advisors, handling everything from contract interpretations to complex transition issues.

In 2014, they ventured into inside sales, where they quickly proved their mettle in the steel grating industry. They didn't just sell products; they built relationships, serving as a vital link between drafting and sales teams. Their analytical mind shone through as they developed comprehensive competitive comparison tables for pricing and product performance.

Their career took another exciting turn in 2015 at a new company, where they made quite an impression by achieving 170% of their first 90-day quota – the second-highest rookie quarter performance in the company's 21-year history! They mastered the art of prioritizing workflows and crafting sales contracts with precision.

Most recently, from 2016 to 2017, they took on the role of Sales Coordinator, where they demonstrated their ability to drive results through intensive cold calling in the oil and gas, energy, and aerospace sectors. Their management of 250 accounts led to an impressive 36% increase in proposals within just four months.

Now, they're evolving their career by pursuing advanced data analytics. They've developed a robust toolkit including R, Excel modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning, complemented by visualization tools like Tableau. Their unique combination of sales experience and analytical skills positions them perfectly for roles that bridge business and data science.

Throughout their career, they've maintained active involvement in professional communities, including membership in the University of Houston-Downtown Analytics Society, showing their commitment to continuous learning and professional growth.

This is the story of someone who's successfully combined relationship-building expertise with analytical capabilities, and is now poised to take on new challenges in the data analytics field.
